intro: Bolax spinosa, commonly known as the spiny bolax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant features prominently spiny bracts and stems, which serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Bolax spinosa thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
